result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal J Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Crystal J Andrews is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Crystal J Andrews was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber for Employment, Child Care or Counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal J Andrews

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. No appearance by DE. Atty Breckenfelder does not appear for this hearing.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  205 - DE has contacted the court to state she no longer believes she qualifies for a reduced price on IID, as she has recently gained employment. Court takes no action.
Hearing on November 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
for Half-Priced IID filed by DE pro se. Matter set for hearing per Judge Meier. NTBS.
AMENDED Fine/costs to $2452.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.  $200 for DNA charge.
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
Fine/costs due in the amount of $2252.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder. DE's mother present.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1008 - Case is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Statement from DE's mother. Defendant is sentenced to 90 days in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber for employment, child care, or counseling.  Credit for 12 days. DE given credit for Chapter 85 completion. Court orders a $1200 fine plus costs, due in 30 days after release or civil judgment. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. DL suspended for 27 months. Ignition interlock ordered. Intox assessment ordered. ELM authorized. Appeal rights given. Certified copy of minutes given to deputy, and DE taken into custody.
from WCS. Program requirements satisfied.
At the request of Atty Breckenfelder - DE to be entering a plea. PLEAS rescheduled for 5/26 @ 10am. Attys confirm by email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1037 - Atty Breckenfelder requests adjournment - WCS report rec'd. DE debating whether or not a JT is needed. Atty Breckenfelder also requests WCS reporting be reduced to once weekly to better accommodate DE's work schedule. Court grants reduction in visits to once weekly.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Program requirements satisfied.

ST has no objection on adjournment and no position as to WCS reporting. Court modifies reporting to WCS pending next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Balance of $20 of client fee to be paid.

from WCS. Treatment to be completed and service fee paid.
from WCS. Non-compliant - specifically by failing to cooperate with random UA.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk: MHerr.

from WCS - not all conditions met. Service fee outstanding, inconsistent attendance through NICASA.
